avalancheActivity.comment:
The sometimes large wind slabs of the last few days can be released easily or naturally.
Avalanches can be released, even by a single winter sport participant. Such avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, in particular on steep slopes at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
Until the temperature drops more frequent dry and moist avalanches are to be expected, even medium-sized ones. In the typical avalanche paths they can in isolated cases reach as far as the valley bottom. The danger of moist avalanches will already increase in the late morning.
avalancheActivity.highlights: As a consequence of rising temperatures, partly cloudy skies and the foehn wind, an unfavourable avalanche situation will develop on Friday. Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for restraint.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some localities 20 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last two days. Since Thursday on steep slopes several small and medium-sized avalanches were observed.
The sometimes strong wind has transported a lot of snow. In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2000 m, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Distinct weak layers exist in the bottom section of the old snowpack in all aspects.
Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.

tendency.highlights: Gradual decrease in danger of moist avalanches as the temperature drops. The weather conditions will facilitate a gradual change towards better conditions.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The wind slabs of Thursday can be released naturally, in particular on very steep slopes. In isolated cases avalanches can be released in deep layers reach medium size.
Even single winter sport participants can release avalanches in some places. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack. These avalanche prone locations are barely recognisable, even to the trained eye.
Until the temperature drops numerous dry and moist avalanches are to be expected.
avalancheActivity.highlights: As a consequence of rising temperatures and partly cloudy skies a sometimes unfavourable avalanche situation will develop.

snowpackStructure.comment:
10 to 20 cm of snow fell in the last two days. The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow.
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a weakly bonded old snowpack. Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in all aspects.
The snowpack will be generally subject to considerable local variations.
At low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.
Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.

tendency.highlights: Gradual decrease in danger of moist avalanches as the temperature drops. The weather conditions will facilitate a gradual change towards better conditions.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh snow of the last two days as well as local wind slabs are lying on top of a weakly bonded old snowpack in particular on shady slopes.
Wind slabs can in some places be released by people. This applies especially at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, especially in pass areas in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, especially on very steep slopes. Such avalanche prone locations are covered with new snow and are therefore difficult to recognise.
Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
Until the temperature drops dry and moist avalanches are possible, but they will be mostly small.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Be careful, many rocks hidden by fresh snow. The more recent wind slabs are small and in some cases prone to triggering.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER

snowpackStructure.comment:
5 to 10 cm of snow, but less in some localities, fell on Thursday. The southeasterly wind has transported the new snow, in particular in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 3 (considerable).
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. On steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

tendency.highlights: Gradual decrease in danger of moist avalanches as the temperature drops. The weather conditions will facilitate a gradual change towards better conditions.
